critique: This document adjusts rates of pay and allowances for various government employees, including those in the uniformed services, executive branch, congress, and judiciary. It does not touch upon immigration, civil liberties, or social inclusion. It also does not seem to expand executive power or shift the balance of power between the federal and state governments. It is primarily an economic action, adjusting pay in response to cost of living. It does not seem to have a strong ideological tilt.
